board.clue: Henry Ford revolutionized manufacturing by introducing this moving method of production in 1913.
Often made of rubber or PVC, this loop of material transports goods from point A to point B.
This four-letter federal agency sets the standards for safety and health in the manufacturing workplace.
Toyota pioneered this inventory strategy, abbreviated JIT, to decrease waste and increase efficiency.
Motorola developed this data-driven methodology that aims for near-perfection, allowing only 3.4 defects per million opportunities.
This orange, lasagna-loving cat has been hating Mondays since 1978.
Sanrio's mouthless icon, who is technically a little girl and not a cat, wears a red bow on her left ear.
In 'Alice in Wonderland', this magical feline is known for his mischievous grin and ability to disappear.
Before he was a puppet in the 90s sitcom, this black cat was a warlock sentenced to live as a feline for trying to take over the world.
This ginger ship's cat was the sole survivor of the Nostromo incident in the movie 'Alien'.
A hand containing five cards of the same suit, regardless of rank.
The art of betting aggressively with a weak hand to make your opponent fold.
The most popular variant of poker today, featuring two hole cards and five community cards.
Following the flop and the turn, this is the name given to the fifth and final community card dealt.
Wild Bill Hickok was holding this two-pair hand of aces and eights when he was shot in Deadwood.
board.answer: What is the Dead Man's Hand?

board.clue: This improvisational genre of music was born in New Orleans in the late 19th and early 20th centuries.
Nicknamed 'Satchmo', this trumpeter and vocalist is New Orleans' most famous musical son.
Clifton Chenier was the 'King' of this accordion-heavy musical style that blends blues and Creole traditions.
It's the tradition of brass band parades where participants dance behind the main band, often twirling parasols.
Malcolm John Rebennack Jr. performed voodoo-influenced psychedelic rock under this medical moniker.
Julia Quinn wrote the series of romance novels that inspired this hit Netflix show about the Bridgerton siblings.
This 2001 novel by Philippa Gregory focuses on Mary, the sister of a famous beheaded queen.
board.answer: What is The Other Boleyn Girl?

board.clue: In this Diana Gabaldon series, a WWII nurse touches a stone circle in Scotland and travels back to 1743.
Hilary Mantel's 'Wolf Hall' explores the rise of this chief minister to Henry VIII.
He wrote 'The Pillars of the Earth', a massive epic centered on the construction of a cathedral in 12th-century England.
A graphic mark or emblem used to promote public recognition of a brand.
Short for 'weblog', this is a regularly updated website written in an informal style.
A systematic list of items, often found in a library or a mail-order booklet.
The study of correct reasoning, or a rapper known for the song '1-800-273-8255'.
The opposite of digital, referring to technology like vinyl records or clock faces with hands.
It's the complete list of items such as property, goods in stock, or the contents of a building.
In process analysis, this is a point of congestion that slows down the entire system.
Pronounced 'skew', this acronym stands for a unique code assigned to a product for identification.
This Japanese philosophy focuses on continuous improvement involving all employees from the CEO to the assembly line workers.
Invented around 1910, this type of bar chart illustrates a project schedule and dependency relationships.
This Tudor king created a religious schism just to annul his marriage to Catherine of Aragon.
Though she likely never said 'Let them eat cake', this queen was guillotined during the French Revolution.
Some historians blame this hunchbacked king for the disappearance of his nephews, the Princes in the Tower.
This mystic and advisor to the Romanovs survived being poisoned and shot before finally drowning.
King Edward VIII abdicated the British throne in 1936 to marry this American socialite.
These deep-fried squares of choux pastry are dusted with powdered sugar and famously served at Caf√© Du Monde.
This official state cuisine of Louisiana is a stew that starts with a dark roux and includes the 'Holy Trinity' of vegetables.
This sandwich, served on French bread, often features fried shrimp, oysters, or roast beef.
Central Grocery in New Orleans claims to have invented this sandwich piled high with Italian meats and olive salad.
Brennan's Restaurant created this flaming dessert made with fruit, brown sugar, cinnamon, rum, and banana liqueur.
Ariel trades her voice for legs in this Hans Christian Andersen fairy tale.
Meg, Jo, Beth, and Amy March are the sisters in this Louisa May Alcott classic.
This capital city of Arkansas was the site of a major Civil Rights integration event at Central High School in 1957.
The architect of rock and roll who sang 'Tutti Frutti' and 'Good Golly, Miss Molly'.
This asterism in Ursa Minor contains Polaris, the North Star.
She was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize and the only person to win them in two different scientific fields.
Daughter of Lord Byron, she is often considered the first computer programmer for her work on the Analytical Engine.
This Navy rear admiral was a pioneer of computer programming and popularized the term 'debugging'.
A Hollywood star of the 1940s, she co-invented frequency-hopping spread spectrum technology, a precursor to Wi-Fi.
Portrayed by Taraji P. Henson in 'Hidden Figures', her orbital calculations were critical to the success of the first U.S. crewed spaceflights.
A Pat Sajak game show combines with a crunchy dessert found in Chinese restaurants.
board.answer: What is Wheel of Fortune Cookie?

board.clue: A fast-food chain with a chihuahua mascot combines with a glass container for preserving jam.
A 15-time major golf champion combines with the opening on a green where you sink your putt.
A Disney princess who lost a glass slipper combines with the opulent California estate built by a newspaper magnate.
The British Secret Service agent 007 combines with a place where stocks and bonds are traded.

final.clue: This card game, a favorite of James Bond in the original novels, is often played in a roped-off area and allows players to take turns acting as the banker.
